BioModel.name: CM_PM12648679_MB10::Substrate_depletion_oscillator
BioModel.text: signal strength. Rate of synthesis of species X
phosphorylation of the enzymatic protein (E), modulated by the response element (R)
species X. In the mechanism of MPF oscillations in frog egg extracts, R is the phosphorylated form of cyclin B-CDK1
phosphorylated form of E, an enzymatic protein. In the mechanism of MPF oscillations in frog egg extracts, Ep is the phosphatase Cdc25

This ModelBrick from the article, " Sniffers, buzzers, toggles and blinkers â€¦" describes a substrate-depletion oscillator. Species X is converted into R in an autocatalytic process. At first, X is abundant and R is scarce. As R builds up, R production accelerates until there is an explosive conversion of the entire pool of X into R. Then the autocatalytic reaction shuts off for lack of substrate, X. R is degraded, and X must build up again before another burst of R is produced. This is essentially the mechanism of MPF oscillations in frog egg extracts.
enzymatic protein. In the mechanism of MPF oscillations in frog egg extracts, E is the phosphatase Cdc25
response element. In the mechanism of MPF oscillations in frog egg extracts, R is the unphosphorylated form of cyclin B-CDK1 or active MPF.
signal strength. Rate of synthesis of species X
